intro: Eriochrysis rangacharii, commonly known as the golden hairgrass, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage with slender, bright green leaves that often have a golden hue under sunlight. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikes, and it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Eriochrysis rangacharii is often found in marshy areas and is adapted to fluctuating water levels. Its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed sites make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
